DOC.brief_summary: This pilot feasibility study evaluate patient ST depression Acute Coronary Syndrome take directly catheter laboratory angiogram angioplasty +/- stent fare well patient take ward area manage drug therapy stabilise 24 hour take catheter laboratory .
DOC.brief_title: Direct Angioplasty Non ST Elevation Acute Coronary Events : DANCE Pilot Study
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Patients present symptom ( onset symptom ≤ 12 hour ) suspect acute coronary syndrome ( unstable angina MI without persistent ST elevation ) characterise follow Clinical history consistent ongoing ischaemic chest pain and/or symptom AND > 1mm ST depression AND/OR ≥2mm T wave inversion least two adjacent ECG lead Pathological T wave inversion lead 1+4 suggest 'LAD Syndrome ' Or Ischaemic ST depression/T wave inversion fulfil criterion felt opinion attend physician represent acute coronary syndrome . AND Written inform consent Main exclusion criterion 1 . ≤ 18 year age 2 . Previous Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting surgery 3 . ST elevation myocardial infarction 4 . Left bundle branch block ( LBBB ) 5 . ST depression see patient pace mode 6 . Heart rate ≥ 150bpm 7 . Cardiogenic shock catastrophic state 8 . If opinion physician patient suitable revascularisation due comorbidity 9 . Patient participate another clinical trial randomisation DANCE would result deviation protocol stipulation either trial .
